text: Kem Ley (; 19 October 1970 – 10 July 2016) was a Cambodian activist, physician, and political commentator. He was known for his political commentary, including trenchant criticisms of the government led by Cambodian People's Party (CPP). Ley was shot on the morning of 10 July 2016 in a café at a gas station in Phnom Penh. == References == Category:1970 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Cambodian people Category:Assassinated people Category:Human rights activists Category:Physicians Category:Deaths by firearm Category:Murder victims
title: Kem Ley
